(2009) {{Audiosample | Upper caption = Audio sample | Name = Maybe | Audio file = Mini Viva Left My Heart In Tokyo sample.ogg }} }} "'''Left My Heart in Tokyo'''" is a song by British [[girl group]] [[Mini Viva]], co-written by Norwegian singer [[Annie (Norwegian singer)|Annie]] and remixer [[Fred Falke]] and produced by [[Brian Higgins (producer)|Brian Higgins]] and his production team [[Xenomania]]. The song was released as Mini Viva's debut single in September 2009. [[NME]] called the song "the catchiest single of 2009."[http://www.nme.com/blog/index.php?blog=15&p=6827&more=1&c=1 Mini Viva Are About To Release The Catchiest Single Of 2009, NME, 25 Jul 2009] The single was originally released as a 10" vinyl single in December 2008 on World's Finest Records, featuring two mixes by [[Fred Falke]]. ==Critical reception== Nick Levine of [[Digital Spy]] gave the song 4/5, stating: "...Make no mistake, their debut single sounds like a chart invader. With its swooning chorus, inventive, disco-tinged production and lyrics that sound great even when they don't quite make sense, 'Left My Heart in Tokyo' is vintage Xenomania."http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/a173854/mini-viva-left-my-heart-in-tokyo.html Fraser McAlpine of [[BBC]]'s "Chart Blog" also rated the song 4/5: "What sets this apart from other generic acts of dance-pop [...] is the infectious energy that singers Frankee and Britt bring to it: whether it's snarling out the verses, purring the bridge, or vamping the chorus, I can't help thinking that recording this single sounds like it was a lot of fun, and it's the sort of fun that they're generously passing on to all of our ears."http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/chartblog/2009/09/mini_viva_i_left_my_heart_in_t.shtml The song was placed on [[BBC Radio 1]]'s A-list. ==Music video== The music video for "Left My Heart in Tokyo" was filmed during early June 2009 in [[Los Angeles]] and was directed by [[Ray Kay]].
